content:
The "Rail Merger Reform and Customer Protection Act" amends Section 11324(c) of title 49, United States Code, to require the Surface Transportation Board to consider factors such as increasing competition among rail carriers, maintaining transportation alternatives for current customers, providing additional transportation options, improving service, and complying with antitrust laws before approving any rail transaction. The Board must consult with the Attorney General and obtain their agreement on antitrust law compliance. The Board must consult with the Attorney General and obtain their agreement on antitrust law compliance. SEC. 3. SURFACE TRANSPORTATION BOARD JURISDICTION. Amendments to Section 10501(b) of title 49, United States Code, state that rail carriers and transportation under the Board's jurisdiction are subject to antitrust laws. This does not limit remedies available under this part. Additionally, all orders and permits issued by agencies must comply with antitrust laws. Amendments to Section 10501(b) of title 49, United States Code, state that rail carriers and transportation under the Board's jurisdiction are subject to antitrust laws, including section 5 of the Clayton Act. All orders and permits issued by agencies must comply with antitrust laws. The Rail Merger Reform and Customer Protection Act ensures that existing agreements remain in effect until modified or revoked by the relevant authorities. The Rail Merger Reform and Customer Protection Act amends Section 10501(b) of title 49, United States Code, to subject rail carriers and transportation under the Board's jurisdiction to antitrust laws, including section 5 of the Clayton Act. This includes compliance with section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act for unfair methods of competition. SEC. 4. RATE AGREEMENTS. Amendments to Section 10706 of title 49, United States Code include removing references to antitrust laws and making conforming amendments to chapter 107. Amendment to section 10706 of title 49, United States Code involves removing references to antitrust laws in the table of sections for chapter 107. SEC. 5. SCOPE OF AUTHORITY: Amends Section 11321(a) of title 49, United States Code to subject rail carriers and rail transportation to antitrust laws. 

SEC. 6. ELECTION OF REMEDIES: Adds subsection (d) to Section 11701 of title 49, United States Code, stating that a person cannot proceed against a rail carrier under both subsection (b) and other Federal or State law for the same claim. The Clayton Act is amended in sections 7, 11, and 16 by removing certain language related to the Surface Transportation Board and jurisdiction under title 49 of the United States Code.
